body:
Startup tip:

When a potential customer, client, vendor, or investor doesn't reply, email them again.

A week later, again.

A week after that, again.

You'd be surprised how many people aren't ignoring you. They're just swamped. Your following up isn't annoying.

It's helpful.

💡basic marketing tips for web3 companies👇

i’ve been giving some advice to web3 startups that have been hiring their first marketing roles, and here’s what i see 🧵

🌟 Motivation Tip 🌟

Sometimes you're unmotivated, right?
Do you know why?

It's either:
- You've got the wrong goal or
- You've got the wrong plan

How to fix? I'll explain it in this threat 🧵
👇👇👇

#buildinpublic #startups #100DaysOfCode #coding #python #java
pro tip: if you name your startup after a fresh word from Lord Of The Rings you can still raise 20M without a deck, no cap
Best tips for what early stage #startup founders want to see on potential hires’ resumes???

Hiring tips for early stage bootstrapped entrepreneurs:
Don't go after the so-called 1st class talent who worked in VC backed startups & have an "impressive" track record.

Look for hustlers who are eager to learn and who want to prove something to themselves.

The art of follow-up: 

Whether raising funding for a startup, for a venture capital fund or for potential partnerships, your follow-up game needs to be strong. 

Here’s a few tips I’ve learned from the 👑 of follow-up @myfriendjanine

Any tips for resetting your Following list and starting over? 

Want to rebuild my feed with non-mainstream news, hard science, and less baseless chatter about startups, investing and threads about life from people whose primary form of socialization is this website.
I'm looking for some great reads on employee engagement for this week's Startup Life newsletter. Any tips? 🙏

Why has the uncle spent about 6 minutes talking about his startup? 

Isn’t the topic “building a successful startup?”

Why hasn’t he dropped any meaningful, relevant tip yet? 

Sounds more like a Grammy appreciation speech than a masterclass. 

Lmao!!
Any tips for interviewing engineers as a PM at a startup?

I hope others in #startup ecosystem have days when their brains just refuse to function...

I have such day today and it makes me super anxious. Any tips please..?

Personal Branding Tip #5

You are your own StartUp
You are your own Brand
You are your own Marketer
Your connections are the investments. 

Keep building yourself..

Tip: How to support black African founders & startups

This is NOT support:
Throwing a hissy fit on twitter when African based white founders get funding.

This is support:
CELEBRATE black founders/startups
USE their products
Give CONSTRUCTIVE feedback
REFER customers & investors

Looking for good podcast recommendations for founders — no preference for specific topic, can range from startups generally, to management tips, building product, hiring, fundraising, market conditions, etc — send them my way! 🤓
Quick tip: While applying for startups, consider visiting their LinkedIn page and viewing the funding they have.

gm startup twitter 🌅 at the moment I collate feedback from beta users in a google sheet, which I input myself from emails/notes from calls. 

@levelsio @tdinh_me @noahwbragg any tips of how you gather user feedback and what tools you use to optimize this? thanks :)

A tip of hat to every #startup in India for playing a significant role towards building a sustainable and super economy. And also a word to the young minds that are abuzz with definitive and world changing ideas, never give up.

Thank you @launchhouse for giving me the right tips to start my Twitter! Startup drop happening soon ;)

productivity tips for newcomers to web3:
- turn on your notifications (including sounds)
- have a dedicated monitor for Discord
- break up with your friends so you can work 22/7 on your startup
Pro tip for fintech startups: don’t bring a Ruby on Rails app to a gun fight.
Giving startup tips without actually building one is a crime.
Hey VCs! What are your top fundraising tips for entrepreneurs? #startups #VentureCapital #halogenvc

Our startups grow beyond our geographical borders. Countries are wanting to learn & engage from India.

Even #IndiaAtDubaiExpo, have over 150 startups showcasing their products with huge pitching sessions. The potential has barely touched the tip of the iceberg: @PiyushGoyal

next week I’m hosting a workshop at my university on building a personal brand on twitter and using that to get great jobs at startups or to grow your entrepreneurship career! if anyone has any success stories or tips on that topic that you think I should include, pls DM ❤️❤️
Comment down with your startup idea and we’ll give one tip that may help you 🚀🚀

Tip for creating Tiktok content: Share value, not just  aesthetics.

If you like fashion, share where you shop. Not just your outfit.

If you have a dog, share what vacuum you use. Not just your walk.

If you are building a startup, share the process. Not just your end result.

I just learned yesterday that you can Kara your normal’s startup into FD after super flash to block a reversal super 😭😭

What are some other gameplay tips about GGST that aren’t commonly known?
🤔 Asking for a founder: do you have tips on how a growing startup can scale customer support while maintaining the quality of service provided?

Pro tip: if you’re experiencing a lot of lag in @TheSims 4 like I have been since the Sims delivery express update go into game options > Sims delivery Express and set it to only look for new content on startup or never, it makes a HUGE difference in performance.

Hiring tip: give paid test projects.

You’ll attract talented people to work at your startup.

Test projects help you see work style, attention to detail, and how they think.

Another tip: request access to customer conversations via Gong and login to Amplitude/LogRocket dashboard to analyze product usage and retention.

The product-market fit risk is real! So do your diligence and be aware of all the risks before joining the startup.

Some personal news: today is my first day as a full-time junior reporter at @BusinessInsider! I’m still covering venture capital and startups but with more of a focus on the careers side of things. Big thanks to the whole startups team this past 6 months. Reach out with tips!

Most founders treat product launches like a one-time spike. But it's more of a marathon.

Here's one tip I use: 🔑

Treat every day as if the world woke up and forgot about my startup/project

Now find a new way to surface the story
Hello fellow people in companies and startups: Do any of you use Notion extensively within the organization? Any solid tips and tricks and resources and templates?

Finding focus in your startup, career, or life isn't easy. 

What are your top tips to focus?
Quick SEO tip. List your startup on Crunchbase. Don’t say I didn’t do anything for you 😅
